alert.note: Alert for Lower Iberia; Lower St. Martin; Lower St. Mary; Lower Vermilion; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Martin; Upper St. Mary (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 10:31PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT IBERIA...NORTHWESTERN ST. MARY... EAST CENTRAL VERMILION AND CENTRAL ST. MARTIN PARISHES THROUGH 1115 PM CST... At 1030 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Butte La Rose to 7 miles southwest of Avery Island. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Iberia, Catahoula, Franklin, St. Martinville, Jeanerette, Avery Island, Baldwin, Delcambre, Loreauville, Glencoe, Lydia, Acadiana Regional Airport, Sorrel, Cote Blanche Island, Lake Fausse Pointe, Charenton, and Weeks Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lower Iberia; Lower St. Martin; Lower St. Mary; Lower Vermilion; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Martin; Upper St. Mary
